content:
Diagnosis:	Anaplastic pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma (WHO grade III)
	Right temporal lobe lesion diagnosed March 2024
	BRAF V600E mutation positive, CDKN2A/B loss

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the neuro-oncology clinic following completion of cycle 2 of adjuvant temozolomide. The patient has made an excellent recovery from their initial craniotomy performed by [redacted name] on 15/3/24, which achieved a gross total resection. Post-operative MRI on 17/3/24 confirmed no residual enhancing disease.

The molecular pathology results confirmed BRAF V600E mutation and CDKN2A/B loss, and following MDT discussion, the patient completed a course of involved-field radiotherapy (60Gy in 30 fractions) which finished on 30/4/24. They then commenced adjuvant temozolomide at 150mg/m2 D1-5 q28 days from 21/5/24.

I am pleased to report that cycle 1 was well tolerated with only grade 1 nausea and minimal fatigue. The dose was escalated to 200mg/m2 for cycle 2 as planned. Current cycle has been similarly well-tolerated with good compliance to antiemetics. Surveillance MRI performed yesterday shows no evidence of disease recurrence.

On examination today, the surgical wound has healed well. Neurological examination is normal with no focal deficits. The patient reports continued improvement in exercise tolerance and has returned to work part-time. Blood results show stable FBC with platelets 245 and neutrophils 3.2, normal renal and liver function.

The plan is to continue with cycle 3 temozolomide at the current dose of 200mg/m2. We will arrange the next surveillance MRI prior to cycle 4. I have provided antiemetic prescriptions and discussed the importance of reporting any new neurological symptoms promptly. Review arranged in 4 weeks with blood tests beforehand.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: BRAF V600E mutation positive, CDKN2A/B loss

cancer_timeline.value: Post-operative MRI confirmed no residual enhancing disease
Started adjuvant temozolomide 150mg/m2 D1-5 q28 days
Temozolomide dose escalated to 200mg/m2 for cycle 2
Surveillance MRI shows no evidence of disease recurrence

patient_facts.value: Surgical wound healed well, normal neurological examination with no focal deficits
Stable FBC with platelets 245 and neutrophils 3.2, normal renal and liver function
Returned to work part-time with improving exercise tolerance

status_updates.value: WHO grade III anaplastic pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma post gross total resection and radiotherapy. Good tolerance of adjuvant temozolomide with no evidence of recurrence
Grade 1 nausea and minimal fatigue with cycle 2 temozolomide
Continue with cycle 3 temozolomide at current dose of 200mg/m2
Surveillance MRI to be arranged prior to cycle 4
Review in 4 weeks with blood tests beforehand
